subject: Re: Box 13--the reject!?
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
#13 is the coolest looking one i've seen so far, looks straight out 
of a 50's sci-fi movie.  I would maybe leave the plug on there too.  
They may be able to come through clearer with all that current 
running through it from the outlet.  It's as if they have more 
options, but nobody is really sure how evp works really.  They feed 
off energy and it just seems like you would have more current from a 
wall socket than a couple of batteries.

-Steve H.





--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...> 
wrote:
>
> This is a box returned. I replaced the capacitors in the whithe 
noise amp 
> that control the gain, and voila--kick butt box. This is one of 
two that I 
> tried "ugly construction", where the components are mounted on an 
unetched 
> piece of copper clad board in an effort to reduce size. One 
drawback with 
> this box is it's AC powered, so not portable to places wihtout 
power--like 
> grave yards, so I might convert it.  I have one more of these, 
#12, but the 
> tuner needs to be replaced.
> 
> Frank
>
